displaytitle: “Deianeira” lekythos (oil vessel) depicting a mounted satyr pursuing a nymph
creditline: Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund and Carl Otto von Kienbusch Jr. Memorial Collection Fund

titles.title: “Deianeira” lekythos (oil vessel) depicting a mounted satyr pursuing a nymph

makers.displaymaker: in the manner of the Gorgon Painter

texts.textentryhtml: Acquired by the Albright-Knox Gallery, Buffalo, in 1933, from Jacob Hirsch, New York.  Sold by the Albright-Knox at Sotheby's, New York, June 7, 2007, no. 33, to the Museum.

bibliography.boilertext: J. D. Beazley, Attic Black-figure Vase-painters, (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1956).
bibliography.citation: J. D. Beazley, Attic Black-figure Vase-painters, (Oxford: Clarendon Press, 1956)., 12.22; Paralipomena, 8.

bibliography.citation:
Humfry Payne, Necrocorinthia, a study of Corinthian art in the archaic period, (Oxford, UK: Clarendon Press, 1931).

displaymaker: in the manner of the Gorgon Painter
caption: Greek, Attic, Archaic Period (ca. 600–480 BCE), in the manner of the Gorgon Painter, Athens, Greece, ca. 580 BCE, “Deianeira” lekythos (oil vessel) depicting a mounted satyr pursuing a nymph. Black-figure ceramic; 31.7 x 13.6 cm. Museum purchase, Fowler McCormick, Class of 1921, Fund and Carl Otto von Kienbusch Jr. Memorial Collection Fund (2007-39)
